remarks: Any operation is distributive outside its domain.  In contrast to ~ ndmovdistr where it is required that the operation's domain doesn't contain the empty set ( ` -. (/) e. S ` ), no additional assumption is required.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
statement:
ndmaov.1 $e |- dom F = ( S X. S ) $.
ndmaov.6 $e |- dom G = ( S X. S ) $.
ndmaovdistr $p |- ( -. ( A e. S /\ B e. S /\ C e. S ) -> (( A G (( B F C )) )) = (( (( A G B )) F (( A G C )) )) ) $.
